Package ooga.view

Class GameScene

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Scene
ooga.view.GameScene
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
BoardScene, GameConfigScene, WelcomeScene
public abstract class GameScene
extends javafx.scene.Scene
A GameScene object extends Scene and is given to a GameWindow to show. This scene also contains helpful methods for populating scenes.

  • Property Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • GameScene

      public GameScene​(javafx.scene.Parent root, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> handler, java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
      Constructor for GameScene takes a Parent object and a ResourceBundle. The scene root is usually a GridPane for ease of layout.
      Parameters:
      root - the Parent object to act as the root of the scene
      handler -
      resources - a ResourceBundle holding scene data files

  • Method Details

    • getSceneType

      public java.lang.String getSceneType()
      Returns the String scene type of this GameScene.
      Returns:
      a String representing the scene type

    • setSceneSize

      public void setSceneSize​(int width, int height)
      Sets the size of a scene. This will force any window displaying the scene to conform to the size.
      Parameters:
      width - desired width of scene
      height - desired height of scene

    • makeLabel

      public javafx.scene.control.Label makeLabel​(java.lang.String property)
      Creates a text displaying Label object. This object will search properties files for keys matching the input, and set the lable to the corresponding string.
      Parameters:
      property - a String key in the resource file for this scene
      Returns:
      a Label object

    • makeLabels

      public javafx.scene.control.Label[] makeLabels​(java.lang.String labelProperties)

    • setTitle

      public void setTitle​(java.lang.String property)
      Sets the title text of this scene, based on the given property that can be found in the resource bundle for this scene.
      Parameters:
      property - a String property key for the scene title.

    • makeButton

      public javafx.scene.control.Button makeButton​(java.lang.String property)
      Creates a Button in the scene, with text determined by property, and EventHandler specified by the event handler of this scene.
      Parameters:
      property - a String matching a key in the scene source file
      Returns:
      a Button object

    • makeTextField

      public javafx.scene.control.TextField makeTextField​(java.lang.String property)
      Creates a TextField with prompt text set as the string for the given property.
      Parameters:
      property - property key for the prompt text
      Returns:
      a TextField object

    • makeButtons

      public javafx.scene.control.Button[] makeButtons​(java.lang.String buttonProperties)
      Makes a List of Button objects using the button list property name specified. buttonProperties correspond to a list of individual button keys in this scene's ResourceBundle. Eventually, the property key of a button is set as the ID of the button, and its corresponding String is set as the button's label. This also adds a javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> to the buttons created.
      Parameters:
      buttonProperties - a String corresponding to a list of strings in the resource bundle of this scene.
      Returns:
      a list of Buttons.

    • makeButtonBar

      public javafx.scene.Node makeButtonBar​(java.lang.String property)
      Creates a Node of type HBox with one or more Button objects that are usually centered and evenly distributed. This element is usually placed at the top of a scene, but can be placed anywhere.
      Parameters:
      property - the String key in the scene resource bundle with the list of button IDs.
      Returns:
      a Node instance.

    • makeButtonBar

      public javafx.scene.Node makeButtonBar​(javafx.scene.control.Button[] buttons)

    • makeColumnConstraint

      public javafx.scene.layout.ColumnConstraints makeColumnConstraint​(javafx.geometry.HPos position)
      Creates a ColumnConstraints object that aligns a column of a GridPane to the desired HPos.
      Parameters:
      position - Desired position for the constraint
      Returns:
      a ColumnConstraints object

    • populateScene

      public abstract void populateScene()
      Populates the scene with the correct layout panels and view elements depending on the subclass of GameScene.
